shrimp.name: MKGooch
shrimp.author: rconstruct

input.name: B
input.description: Used to construct the cool color

input.name: Y
input.description: Used to contruct the warm color

shrimp.usage: Gooch non photorealistic shading model, by Mike King, as described in an "A Non-Photorealistic Lighting Model for Automatic Technical Illustration", in the Siggraph 1998 proceedings. Ka, Kd, Ks, ambient, diffuse, and specular coefficients respectively, calpha and cbeta, the Gooch cool and warm color factors. B and Y used to contruct the cool and warm color, roughness and specular color, to control specular roughness and color respectively.
